thread.title: 'Reformer" Turnbull flags sovereign wealth fund: reports
thread.title_full: 'Reformer" Turnbull flags sovereign wealth fund: reports | Business Spectator

author: Staff Reporter
title: 'Reformer" Turnbull flags sovereign wealth fund: reports
text:
Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull has put a sovereign wealth fund back on the agenda and declared himself a reformer in a pair of newspaper interviews.
According to The Australian Financial Review , the Prime Minister said Australia should establish a sovereign wealth fund, a policy he has favoured in the past, when the budget returns to surplus.
"We certainly need to get the budget back to balance over the cycle," Mr Turnbull said, the AFR reports. "When you talk about the budget being in balance over the cycle, when the business cycle is roaring ahead and the terms of trade are booming, you want to be running surpluses and putting money in the bank, preferably in a sovereign wealth fund.
"And when times are bad, you've got the ability to spend in a manner that supports aggregate demand when the private sector's in retreat."
Mr Turnbull also said the package he takes to the next election will feature tax reform prominently, though he declined to give details.
"The tax system has to do its job," he said. "It's got to collect the money we need to pay for everything, but beyond that it's got to do everything it can to incentivise people to work, save and invest."
Meanwhile, in an interview with Fairfax newspapers, Mr Turnbull said he is “by nature a reformer,” flagged more borrowing to fund public infrastructure projects and warned China against violating the territorial rights of other countries.
